akn:section.akn:heading: Other claims against dissolved statutory trust.

akn:content.akn:p: A dissolved statutory trust may publish notice of its dissolution and request persons having claims against the trust to present them in accordance with the notice.
A notice under subsection (a) of this section shall:

If a dissolved statutory trust publishes a notice in accordance with subsection (b) of this section, the claim of each of the following claimants is barred unless the claimant commences an action to enforce a claim against the trust not later than 3 years after the publication date of the notice:
A claim not barred under this section or § 29-1208.04 may be enforced against:
A person’s total liability for all claims under subsection (d)(2) of this section does not exceed the total amount of assets distributed to the person after dissolution.
